intro: Trichilia prieureana subsp. vermoesenii, commonly known as the Congo mahogany, is a tropical tree native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes species known for their valuable timber. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. Due to its high-quality hardwood, it is often harvested for commercial use, leading to conservation concerns.
